wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Premium Exchanger platform. Explain its purpose as a WordPress plugin that transforms WordPress into a professional cryptocurrency and e-currency exchange service. Document the architecture as a modular WordPress plugin with MVC-like patterns, leveraging WordPress hooks and shortcode systems. Describe its relationship to other components including themes, merchant integrations, and WordPress core. Include implementation details of the main plugin class initialization, configuration options through WordPress settings, and usage patterns for administrators and end users. Provide practical examples demonstrating how the plugin integrates with WordPress, such as shortcode implementation for exchange interfaces and admin menu integration. Document public interfaces, parameters, and return values from the main plugin entry point. Include diagrams illustrating the high-level architecture and component interactions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Plugin Initialization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the plugin initialization process. Thoroughly explain the bootstrapping sequence when WordPress loads the Premium Exchanger plugin, starting from the main plugin file registration to the instantiation of the core Plugin class. Document the activation and deactivation hooks implementation, including database setup routines and scheduled events registration. Explain the role of the init() method in hooking into WordPress lifecycle events, registering custom post types, taxonomies, and shortcodes. Include concrete examples from class-plugin.php showing how the singleton pattern is implemented and how the plugin registers its components. Address common issues such as activation conflicts, dependency checking, and ionCube loader requirements. Provide guidance on extending the initialization process for custom modules and best practices for hook priority management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Settings Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on the settings configuration system. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the settings interface using WordPress Settings API, including the registration of settings sections, fields, and sanitization callbacks. Document the data model for storing exchange parameters, currency configurations, and platform behavior settings. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how settings are registered, validated, and persisted in the WordPress options system. Explain the relationship between the settings UI and the underlying business logic that uses these values for exchange rate calculations and transaction processing. Address common issues such as settings not saving, validation errors, and conflicts with caching mechanisms, providing specific solutions. Make content accessible to beginners by explaining WordPress settings patterns while providing technical depth on how the exchange-specific settings impact platform behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Currency Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the currency management sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of currency creation, editing, and deletion functionality within the exchange system. Document the data model for currencies including fields such as currency code, name, symbol, decimal precision, and status flags. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how currency records are stored and retrieved from the WordPress database using custom post types. Document the user interface components for currency management, including form validation rules and error handling. Explain relationships with other components such as exchange rates and transaction processing. Address common issues like currency code conflicts, symbol display problems, and decimal precision errors with their solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the integration with WordPress's custom post type system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Exchange Interface
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Exchange Interface sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the multi-step exchange process, including currency selection, amount input, rate calculation, and order confirmation. Document the shortcode-based architecture that enables embedding exchange forms in WordPress pages. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how users select exchange directions, view real-time rates, and submit exchange requests. Explain the integration with the currency and merchant modules for accurate rate calculation and transaction processing. Address common issues such as rate synchronization problems, form validation errors, and transaction timeout scenarios with their solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the JavaScript interactions and AJAX calls used in the interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Payment Processor Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for payment processor setup in the exchange platform. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of configuring various payment processors including cryptocurrency wallets and e-currency systems. Document the step-by-step setup process for major processors like Coinbase, PerfectMoney, and Payeer, including required API keys, account credentials, and callback URL configuration. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how merchant classes are instantiated and configured. Explain the relationship between the main merchant system and individual processor implementations. Address common issues such as incorrect API key formatting, callback URL validation failures, and currency mismatch errors with their solutions. Provide best practices for securely storing merchant credentials and testing processor connectivity before going live.

wiki_catalogs.name: Module Development
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on creating custom modules for the exchange platform. Thoroughly explain the module development lifecycle including initialization, registration, and integration with the core system. Document the required file structure, entry point patterns (index.php), and essential hooks for module activation and deactivation. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as the bestchange module implementation, detailing how its add.php, settings.php, and display.php files work together. Explain the use of WordPress hooks and filters for extending functionality, with specific examples from existing modules like api/index.php and api/methods.php. Document configuration patterns using settings.php files and data access methods through functions.php. Address common issues such as namespace collisions, dependency loading order, and debugging module initialization failures. Include performance considerations for autoloading mechanisms and security implications of dynamic module loading.

wiki_catalogs.name: REST API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive REST API documentation for the Premium Exchanger platform. Document all available RESTful endpoints exposed by the plugin, including HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods (WordPress authentication). For each endpoint, detail parameters, return values, error codes, and provide example requests/responses. Include documentation for endpoints related to exchange rates, transactions, user management, and merchant operations. Specify rate limiting policies, versioning strategy, and backwards compatibility guarantees. Include practical examples demonstrating common use cases such as retrieving exchange rates programmatically, creating transactions via API, and managing user data. Address security considerations including authentication mechanisms, data validation, and protection against common web vulnerabilities. Provide client implementation guidelines for different programming languages and performance optimization tips for efficient API usage. Include migration guides for deprecated endpoints and backwards compatibility notes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Exchange API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Exchange API endpoints. Document all HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for exchange rate retrieval, currency conversion calculations, and exchange availability checks. Detail parameters such as source currency, target currency, amount, and any additional options. Provide example requests and responses in JSON format, including successful responses and error conditions. Explain the data structure of exchange rate responses, including rate values, fees, limits, and processing times. Document any rate limiting policies specific to exchange operations and caching recommendations for optimal performance. Include practical examples demonstrating how to integrate exchange functionality into external applications, such as calculating conversion rates in real-time or validating exchange eligibility. Address security considerations including input validation for currency codes and amounts, and protection against abuse of rate calculation endpoints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Installation and Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on installing and configuring the Premium Exchanger plugin. Explain the prerequisites including WordPress installation, PHP 8.3 compatibility, and ionCube Loader requirements. Document the step-by-step installation process through WordPress plugin installer or manual upload. Detail configuration requirements such as database setup, file permissions, and server requirements. Include implementation details of the activation process, dependency checking, and environment validation. Provide practical examples demonstrating successful installation verification, troubleshooting common installation issues (like ionCube compatibility errors), and post-installation configuration. Document the integration with WordPress settings system and any required modifications to wp-config.php. Address common issues such as PHP version conflicts, ionCube loader errors, and file permission problems with their solutions. Include performance considerations for server configuration and security implications of the installation process.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Modeling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Premium Exchanger system. Detail the custom post types implementation for managing exchange transactions, currency pairs, exchange directions, and merchant accounts. Document entity relationships between exchange orders, users, payment methods, and transaction logs. Explain field definitions, data types, and meta information stored for each custom post type. Describe primary mechanisms for data validation and sanitization throughout the system. Include database schema diagrams illustrating the relationship between WordPress native tables and custom data structures. Document data access patterns using WordPress query APIs and custom functions in functions.php. Address performance considerations for querying high volumes of exchange records, indexing strategies, and caching approaches. Specify data lifecycle management including retention policies for transaction records and archival procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on user management capabilities in the admin panel. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the user interface using WordPress List Table patterns to display and manage exchange users, including custom columns for account status, verification level, and transaction history. Document the integration with WordPress user system and any custom user meta fields used for exchange-specific data. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how user data is queried, displayed, and modified through the admin interface. Explain the relationship between user management functions and security features like verification workflows and access controls. Address common issues such as user data not displaying correctly, bulk action failures, and permission conflicts, providing specific troubleshooting steps. Make content accessible to beginners by explaining user management concepts while providing technical depth on the custom list table implementation and database queries used.

wiki_catalogs.name: Exchange Rate Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the exchange rate configuration sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of exchange rate management, including manual rate setting, automatic rate synchronization from external sources like BestChange, and rate calculation algorithms. Document the architecture of currency pairs (directions) and how they are configured with buy/sell rates, commissions, and availability rules. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how exchange rates are stored, updated, and retrieved. Explain relationships with other components such as currency management and transaction processing. Address common issues like rate synchronization failures, incorrect commission calculations, and stale rate data with their solutions. Cover both manual configuration through the admin interface and automated updates through scheduled tasks. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the rate calculation logic and caching mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Account Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Account Management sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of user registration, profile editing, password recovery, and account verification processes. Document the integration with WordPress user system including custom user meta fields for storing exchange-specific information. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing user registration with email verification, profile update workflows, and password reset procedures. Explain the data model for user accounts, including custom fields for security settings, transaction limits, and verification status. Address common issues such as email delivery problems, account lockout scenarios, and profile update failures with their solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the database schema and security implementations.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for API configuration of merchant integrations. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of the API abstraction layer that standardizes communication with diverse payment providers. Document the interface contracts that all merchant classes must implement, including methods for balance checking, transaction initiation, and status verification. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how different merchants handle API authentication (API keys, OAuth, WMID signatures). Explain the relationship between the core plugin architecture and merchant-specific API implementations. Address common issues such as API rate limiting, authentication failures, and version compatibility with their solutions. Provide best practices for handling API changes from payment providers and implementing fallback mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Module Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on integrating third-party and existing modules into the exchange platform. Thoroughly explain implementation details of the module loading mechanism, including how the system discovers and initializes modules in the moduls directory. Document the invocation relationship between core system components and module entry points, using the bestchange module as a primary example to illustrate API integration patterns. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how the api module provides REST-like endpoints through api.php and how the seo module enhances frontend output. Explain the domain model of module dependencies and configuration inheritance. Address common issues such as module conflicts (e.g., multiple SEO tools), loading failures due to PHP version incompatibilities, and configuration override problems. Include performance considerations for module initialization overhead and caching strategies for module metadata.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shortcode API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the Shortcode API system in the Premium Exchanger platform. Document all available shortcodes including [premium_exchange], [premium_reserv], [premium_lastexchanges], [premium_register], and [premium_login]. For each shortcode, specify attributes/parameters, default values, return/output format, and usage examples. Explain how shortcodes are processed and rendered within WordPress content. Include practical implementation examples showing how to embed exchange functionality in posts, pages, and widgets. Document customization options and styling possibilities. Address common issues such as shortcode execution order, parameter validation, and security considerations when using shortcodes with user input. Provide guidance on creating custom shortcodes by extending the existing system.

wiki_catalogs.name: User API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for User Management endpoints. Document all available operations including user registration, authentication, profile retrieval, and account status checks. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication mechanisms (including JWT or WordPress cookie-based authentication). Detail parameters for user creation and update operations, including required fields, validation rules, and optional attributes. Provide example requests and responses for common scenarios such as user login, profile retrieval, and registration. Document error codes related to authentication failures, validation errors, and permission issues. Include security considerations such as password handling, session management, and protection against brute force attacks. Provide guidance on implementing secure user management in client applications and best practices for handling user data privacy in compliance with relevant regulations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Premium Exchanger core system. Describe the high-level design as a modular WordPress plugin architecture with separation of concerns between business logic, data access, and presentation layers. Document the architectural patterns including event-driven design using WordPress hooks, modular plugin system, and MVC-like organization. Explain component interactions between the main plugin class, modules system, merchant integrations, and WordPress core. Detail data flows from user input through exchange calculation to transaction processing and storage. Explain technical decisions behind extending WordPress functionality, trade-offs between tight WordPress integration versus standalone system design, and constraints imposed by the WordPress ecosystem. Include infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations for handling high transaction volumes, and deployment topology options. Provide system context diagrams showing component breakdown and interaction patterns. Address cross-cutting concerns like security implementation, logging mechanisms, error handling strategies, and monitoring approaches. Document the technology stack including WordPress core dependencies, PHP 8.3 features utilized, and ionCube protection mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Utility Functions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the utility functions system. Thoroughly explain the implementation of core utility functions that handle currency formatting, exchange rate calculations, string manipulation, and data encryption. Document the purpose and usage patterns of hashed_functions.php for securing sensitive data and hashed_bd_functions.php for database-related operations. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how these utilities are used in transaction processing and user data management. Explain the relationship between these utility functions and other components like the exchange engine and merchant integrations. Address common issues such as floating-point precision in currency calculations, timezone handling in transaction timestamps, and error handling in cryptographic operations. Provide performance optimization tips for frequently called utility functions and best practices for extending the utility library with custom functions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Settings
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on security configuration options in the administration panel. Thoroughly explain the implementation of security features including user verification workflows, wallet address validation, and transaction security controls. Document the configuration options for enabling/disabling verification steps, setting security thresholds, and managing trusted addresses. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how security settings are stored and enforced during exchange operations. Explain the relationship between these security settings and the user experience during transactions, highlighting how different configurations impact the exchange process. Address common issues such as verification emails not sending, false positive fraud detection, and configuration conflicts, providing specific solutions. Make content accessible to beginners by explaining security concepts while providing technical depth on the implementation of verification workflows and security checks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the transaction processing sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the exchange transaction workflow from order submission to completion, including validation, rate locking, commission calculation, and status tracking. Document the data model for exchange orders (bids) including fields such as source/destination amounts, currency pairs, user information, and status transitions. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how transactions are processed, stored, and updated through various status states. Explain relationships with other components such as user accounts, merchant integrations, and notification systems. Address common issues like transaction validation failures, payment processing errors, and status synchronization problems with their solutions. Cover both the user-facing exchange process and the administrative order management interface. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the transaction state machine and error recovery mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Security Features sub-feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of two-factor authentication, IP filtering, session management, and wallet security measures. Document the modular architecture that allows administrators to enable and configure various security layers. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how security checks are performed during login, transaction submission, and account access. Explain the integration between the security modules and the core user authentication system, including how verification statuses are stored and checked. Address common issues such as legitimate users being blocked by security filters, 2FA setup problems, and session expiration issues with their solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding the security algorithms and data storage practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for transaction verification processes in merchant integrations. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of verifying incoming payments from external providers, including callback handling, IPN (Instant Payment Notification) processing, and blockchain confirmation monitoring. Document the verification workflows for different merchant types, such as cryptocurrency confirmations (block depth requirements) and e-currency account balance checks. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how verification callbacks are secured against spoofing attacks. Explain the relationship between the transaction verification system and the order management system. Address common issues such as delayed confirmations, duplicate callbacks, and fraudulent payment attempts with their solutions. Provide best practices for setting appropriate confirmation thresholds and implementing automated reconciliation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Module Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on configuring and managing installed modules. Thoroughly explain implementation details of the configuration interface system, including how settings forms are rendered and processed through settings.php files. Document the data flow from user input in admin panels to persistent storage, using the bestchange/settings.php and api/settings.php as concrete examples. Explain the configuration schema design, validation patterns, and error handling mechanisms. Include usage examples showing how administrators can customize module behavior, such as configuring email templates in beautyemail/settings.php or setting API access controls in api/settings.php. Address common issues such as configuration persistence failures, validation errors, and security vulnerabilities in input handling. Include performance considerations for configuration caching and database query optimization when retrieving module settings.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hook System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the WordPress hook-based API system in the Premium Exchanger platform. Document all available action hooks and filter hooks that allow developers to extend and customize plugin functionality. For each hook, specify the hook name, parameters passed, expected return values, and execution context. Include practical examples demonstrating common use cases such as modifying exchange rates, adding custom validation to transactions, extending user profiles, and integrating with third-party services. Document the hook registration process and best practices for hook implementation. Address performance considerations when using hooks and potential conflicts with other plugins. Provide guidance on debugging hook execution and monitoring hook performance. Include examples of both action hooks (for executing code at specific points) and filter hooks (for modifying data).

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for Transaction endpoints. Document all operations related to creating, retrieving, and tracking exchange transactions, including HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Detail the parameters required for transaction creation such as source currency, target currency, amounts, user information, and payment details. Specify the response structure including transaction ID, status, rates, fees, estimated completion time, and tracking information. Provide example requests for initiating transactions and example responses for various transaction states (pending, processing, completed, failed). Document endpoints for retrieving transaction history and checking transaction status by ID. Include error handling guidance for common issues such as insufficient funds, invalid currency pairs, and system maintenance. Address security considerations including validation of transaction amounts, protection against duplicate submissions, and secure handling of transaction data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Exchange System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the exchange system functionality. Explain its purpose as the core transaction processing engine that handles currency conversion, rate calculation, and order management. Document the architecture of the exchange workflow from user input to completed transaction, including rate fetching, commission calculation, and order validation. Include implementation details of exchange rate management, currency pair configuration, and transaction processing logic. Provide practical examples demonstrating different exchange scenarios, such as standard currency conversion, multi-step exchanges, and conditional rate applications. Document public interfaces, parameters, and return values for exchange operations. Include diagrams illustrating the exchange workflow and data model relationships. Address common issues like rate synchronization problems, currency availability errors, and transaction validation failures with their solutions. Include performance considerations for rate calculation algorithms and caching strategies for frequently accessed exchange data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Merchant API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for Merchant Integration endpoints. Document all available operations for merchant transaction verification, payment status updates, and callback notifications. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication mechanisms (such as API keys or HMAC signatures) for secure merchant communication. Detail the payload structure for merchant callbacks including transaction identifiers, payment amounts, currency information, and verification signatures. Provide example requests that simulate merchant payment notifications and example responses for successful processing and error conditions. Document endpoints for querying transaction status from the merchant perspective and handling refund operations. Include security considerations such as signature verification, replay attack protection, and secure storage of API credentials. Provide implementation guidelines for merchants integrating with the platform, including best practices for handling asynchronous notifications and error recovery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Administration Panel
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the administration interface. Explain its purpose as the control center for managing all aspects of the exchange platform, including settings, users, and transactions. Document the architecture of the admin interface built on WordPress admin patterns with custom list tables and settings pages. Include implementation details of the menu structure, capability-based access control, and data presentation components. Provide practical examples demonstrating configuration of exchange parameters, management of user accounts, and monitoring of transaction activity. Document the integration with WordPress admin system, including custom list table implementations for data display and settings API for configuration storage. Address common issues such as permission errors, data display problems, and settings persistence issues with their solutions. Include performance considerations for handling large datasets in admin tables and security implications of admin interface access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Merchant Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on merchant integration capabilities. Explain its purpose as the payment processing gateway system that connects the exchange platform with external payment providers and cryptocurrency networks. Document the architecture of the merchant system with its modular design allowing for multiple payment processor integrations. Include implementation details of the merchant API abstraction layer, transaction verification processes, and callback handling mechanisms. Provide practical examples demonstrating integration with specific merchants like Coinbase, PerfectMoney, and Payeer, including configuration parameters and testing procedures. Document public interfaces for merchant developers, including required methods, callback formats, and error handling protocols. Include diagrams illustrating the transaction flow between the exchange platform and external merchants. Address common issues like payment verification delays, callback security concerns, and merchant API changes with their solutions. Include performance considerations for handling multiple concurrent merchant connections and security requirements for protecting merchant credentials.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Experience
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the end-user experience. Explain its purpose as the interface through which users interact with the exchange platform for registration, login, and transaction execution. Document the architecture of the user-facing components built on WordPress themes and shortcode system. Include implementation details of user authentication flows, account management interfaces, and exchange transaction workflows. Provide practical examples demonstrating user registration with email verification, secure login procedures, and step-by-step exchange processes. Document the integration with WordPress user system, including custom user meta fields, role-based access control, and profile management. Address common issues such as login failures, account verification problems, and transaction submission errors with their solutions. Include performance considerations for responsive design across devices and security requirements for protecting user accounts and personal data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Module System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the extensible module system. Explain its purpose as the framework for adding specialized functionality to the exchange platform without modifying core code. Document the architecture of the modular design with its plugin-like structure allowing for independent development and deployment of features. Include implementation details of module loading mechanisms, dependency management, and configuration interfaces. Provide practical examples demonstrating development of custom modules, integration of third-party modules, and configuration of existing modules like BestChange integration and SEO tools. Document the public interfaces for module developers, including required hooks, configuration patterns, and data access methods. Include diagrams illustrating the module lifecycle and interaction patterns with core system. Address common issues such as module conflicts, loading failures, and configuration errors with their solutions. Include performance considerations for module initialization overhead and security implications of third-party module execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Premium Exchanger database schema. Detail entity relationships between core entities such as Currency, Exchange Rates, Transactions, Users, and Merchants. Document field definitions, data types, and constraints for each database table, including custom post types and meta tables. Explain primary/foreign keys, indexes for performance optimization, and data validation rules enforced at the application level. Include database schema diagrams showing table relationships and normalization structure. Provide sample data illustrating typical records for each entity type. Document data access patterns through WordPress functions and custom queries, caching strategies for frequently accessed data, and performance considerations for query optimization. Specify data lifecycle management including retention policies for transaction records and archival rules. Include data migration paths for schema changes and version management strategies. Address data security requirements, privacy compliance measures, and access control mechanisms for protecting sensitive financial information.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Premium Exchanger platform's public interfaces. Document all available RESTful API endpoints exposed by the plugin, including HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods (primarily WordPress authentication). For each endpoint, detail parameters, return values, error codes, and example requests/responses. Include documentation for WordPress hook-based APIs that allow extension of plugin functionality through action and filter hooks. Document shortcode APIs that enable embedding exchange functionality in posts and pages. For RESTful APIs, specify rate limiting policies, versioning strategy, and backwards compatibility guarantees. Include practical examples demonstrating common use cases such as retrieving exchange rates programmatically, creating transactions via API, and managing user data. Address security considerations including authentication mechanisms, data validation, and protection against common web vulnerabilities. Provide client implementation guidelines for different programming languages and performance optimization tips for efficient API usage. Include migration guides for deprecated endpoints and backwards compatibility notes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on diagnosing and resolving common issues with the Premium Exchanger platform. Explain systematic approaches to problem identification, isolation, and resolution. Document common error categories including installation issues, configuration problems, transaction failures, and performance bottlenecks. For each common issue, provide detailed symptom descriptions, root cause analysis, diagnostic procedures, and step-by-step resolution instructions. Include practical examples demonstrating troubleshooting of specific problems like ionCube loader errors, exchange rate synchronization failures, merchant callback issues, and user authentication problems. Document diagnostic tools and techniques such as log analysis, database inspection, and debugging workflows. Address environmental factors that can cause issues, including server configuration, PHP version compatibility, and WordPress plugin conflicts. Include performance troubleshooting guidance for identifying and resolving slow transaction processing, high memory usage, and database query bottlenecks. Provide escalation procedures for issues that cannot be resolved through standard troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: Upgrade and Migration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on upgrading and migrating the Premium Exchanger platform. Explain the versioning strategy and release cycle for the plugin. Document step-by-step upgrade procedures from previous versions, including backup requirements, compatibility checks, and post-upgrade verification steps. Detail data migration processes for schema changes, including automated migration scripts and manual intervention requirements. Provide practical examples demonstrating safe upgrade practices, rollback procedures, and testing strategies for upgraded installations. Document the migration from PHP 8.2 to PHP 8.3 including code changes required and compatibility considerations. Address common upgrade issues such as broken functionality after upgrade, data corruption during migration, and plugin conflicts with new versions. Include performance considerations for upgrade impact on system availability and security implications of the upgrade process. Provide guidelines for testing upgrades in staging environments before production deployment.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Premium Exchanger WordPress Plugin

## 1. Project Introduction

The Premium Exchanger project is a specialized WordPress plugin designed to create a professional e-currency exchange platform. This system transforms a standard WordPress installation into a fully functional cryptocurrency and e-currency exchange service with comprehensive administrative controls, user management, and transaction processing capabilities.

The core purpose of this project is to provide a turnkey solution for businesses and individuals who want to operate an online currency exchange service without developing the entire system from scratch. The plugin offers a complete ecosystem for managing exchange rates, processing transactions, handling merchant integrations, and providing users with a seamless exchange experience.

Targeted at financial technology companies, cryptocurrency entrepreneurs, and web developers specializing in fintech solutions, this plugin caters to users who require a robust, secure, and feature-rich exchange platform with minimal development overhead. The system appears to be particularly focused on the Russian-speaking market, given the extensive Russian language support and localization throughout the codebase.

## 2. Technical Architecture

The Premium Exchanger plugin follows a modular WordPress plugin architecture that extends the core WordPress functionality to create a specialized exchange platform. The system is built on WordPress as a foundation but implements a comprehensive custom framework for exchange operations.

The architecture consists of several key layers:
- **WordPress Core Integration Layer**: The plugin seamlessly integrates with WordPress hooks, admin interfaces, and database structures
- **Exchange Business Logic Layer**: Custom classes and functions that handle currency exchange operations, rate calculations, and transaction processing
- **Administrative Interface Layer**: An extensive admin panel with customized settings pages for managing all aspects of the exchange
- **User Experience Layer**: Front-end templates and shortcodes that create the user-facing exchange interface

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[WordPress Core] --> B[Premium Exchanger Plugin]
    B --> C[Admin Interface]
    B --> D[Exchange Engine]
    B --> E[User Management]
    B --> F[Transaction Processing]
    C --> G[Settings Management]
    D --> H[Currency Rates]
    D --> I[Exchange Calculations]
    E --> J[User Accounts]
    F --> K[Order Processing]
    F --> L[Payment Integration]
    G --> M[Global Settings]
    G --> N[Security Settings]
    G --> O[Language Settings]
```

The plugin extends WordPress by creating custom admin menu items, implementing rewrite rules for exchange-specific URLs, and defining technical pages for various exchange functions. It maintains its own data structures within the WordPress database while leveraging WordPress user management and authentication systems.

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- [premiumbox.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/premiumbox.php): The main plugin file that initializes the Exchanger class and loads all component modules

### Core Modules
- [class-plugin.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/includes/class-plugin.php): The core plugin class that extends Premium functionality and defines the main exchange system
- [migrate-constants.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/includes/migrate-constants.php): Configuration file that defines security constants for merchant and payment actions

### Configuration Approach
- [wp-config.php](wp-config.php): WordPress configuration file with database settings and debug configuration
- Multiple settings files in the plugin's default directory that create admin interface sections for various configuration aspects

### External Dependencies
The project leverages the WordPress core framework as its primary dependency, utilizing WordPress functions, hooks, and database abstractions. No external package manager dependencies are evident from the structure, as the solution is implemented as a self-contained WordPress plugin.

### Integration Points
- WordPress admin interface integration through custom menu pages and submenus
- URL rewrite rules for exchange-specific endpoints
- Shortcode integration for embedding exchange functionality in pages
- Custom post types and templates for exchange-related content

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[premiumbox.php] --> B[Exchanger Class]
    B --> C[Admin Interface]
    B --> D[Exchange Engine]
    B --> E[User System]
    C --> F[Settings Pages]
    D --> G[Currency Management]
    D --> H[Order Processing]
    E --> I[Account Management]
    F --> J[General Settings]
    F --> K[Admin Panel Settings]
    F --> L[AJAX Settings]
    F --> M[Language Settings]
    F --> N[Writing Settings]
```

## 4. Key Features

The Premium Exchanger plugin offers a comprehensive suite of features for operating a currency exchange service:

1. **Multi-currency Exchange System**: Complete functionality for managing currency pairs, exchange rates, and conversion calculations
2. **Merchant Integration**: Support for merchant accounts and payment processing systems
3. **Comprehensive Admin Panel**: Extensive administrative controls for managing all aspects of the exchange
4. **User Account Management**: Personal accounts, security settings, and transaction history
5. **Multilingual Support**: Full Russian language support with potential for additional languages
6. **Customizable Exchange Interface**: Configurable exchange process with multiple steps and verification
7. **Security Features**: Password protection, action verification, and configurable security settings

The system implements a modular approach to functionality, with separate components for different aspects of the exchange operation. This is evident in the directory structure which separates concerns into distinct modules like currency management, exchange processing, user management, and statistics.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Setup
    Setup --> Configuration: Complete Settings
    Configuration --> UserRegistration: Launch Platform
    UserRegistration --> UserLogin: Register
    UserLogin --> ExchangeProcess: Login
    ExchangeProcess --> SelectCurrencies: Start Exchange
    SelectCurrencies --> EnterAmounts: Choose Pair
    EnterAmounts --> ConfirmTransaction: Input Values
    ConfirmTransaction --> ProcessPayment: Verify Details
    ProcessPayment --> TransactionComplete: Complete Exchange
    TransactionComplete --> UserDashboard: View Results
    UserDashboard --> ExchangeProcess: New Exchange
    UserDashboard --> [*]: Logout
```

Sources:
- [premiumbox.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/premiumbox.php)
- [class-plugin.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/includes/class-plugin.php)
- [wp-config.php](wp-config.php)
- [settings.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/default/settings.php)
- [admin/settings.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/default/admin/settings.php)
- [globalajax/settings.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/default/globalajax/settings.php)
- [lang/index.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/default/lang/index.php)
- [rtl/index.php](wp-content/plugins/premiumbox/default/rtl/index.php)
</blog>
